page.title: 11OLD DUKE WILLIAM INN,TONG.
page.content: We interviewed the landlord and his wife of the Old Duke William public house which is an l80 year old building situated on the busy A 650 road three miles from Bradford. About ten years ago the extensive stabling was pulled down to make a car park. The customers are a mixture of middle and working class; only about l5% live within walking distance, the majority live within ten miles and travel by car. Some long distance lorry drivers who deliver goods to the nearby industrial estate have their meals in the inn and sleep in their purpose built cabs in the car park. The inn offers the usual services, being open for intoxicating drinks twice daily, seven days a week. The most popular drinks are beer and lager although cider and wine are drunk by the younger customers.
